## Functions

### LLVMCantFail() {#ga946eaac2a6fc0b492ffc6e59545c4378}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LLVMCantFail (<a href="#gad81d81a316ef38888533a24b786a6605">LLVMErrorRef</a> Err)</>}>
Report a fatal error if Err is a failure value.

This function can be used to wrap calls to fallible functions ONLY when it is known that the Error will always be a success value.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/error-h/#l00060">60</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/error-h">Error.h</a>, definition at line 187 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/testing/lib/testing/support/error-cpp">Error.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMConsumeError() {#gafa975b13e476c457d93779475f960540}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LLVMConsumeError (<a href="#gad81d81a316ef38888533a24b786a6605">LLVMErrorRef</a> Err)</>}>
Dispose of the given error without handling it.

This operation consumes the error, and the given <a href="#gad81d81a316ef38888533a24b786a6605">LLVMErrorRef</a> value is not usable once this call returns. Note: This method <em>only</em> needs to be called if the error is not being passed to some other consuming operation, e.g. LLVMGetErrorMessage.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/error-h/#l00052">52</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/error-h">Error.h</a>, definition at line 183 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/testing/lib/testing/support/error-cpp">Error.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMEnablePrettyStackTrace() {#gacd4315fc836550166df8bff5bf55dc32}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void LLVMEnablePrettyStackTrace (void)">
Enable LLVM&#39;s built-in stack trace code.

This intercepts the OS&#39;s crash signals and prints which component of LLVM you were in at the time if the crash.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/errorhandling-h/#l00049">49</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/errorhandling-h">ErrorHandling.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/prettystacktrace-cpp/#l00323">323</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/prettystacktrace-cpp">PrettyStackTrace.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMGetErrorMessage() {#ga089f52c976405b1df7daa6718bbed82a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>char &#42; LLVMGetErrorMessage (<a href="#gad81d81a316ef38888533a24b786a6605">LLVMErrorRef</a> Err)</>}>
Returns the given string&#39;s error message.

This operation consumes the error, and the given <a href="#gad81d81a316ef38888533a24b786a6605">LLVMErrorRef</a> value is not usable once this call returns. The caller is responsible for disposing of the string by calling LLVMDisposeErrorMessage.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/error-h/#l00068">68</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/error-h">Error.h</a>, definition at line 191 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/testing/lib/testing/support/error-cpp">Error.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMErrorTypeId LLVMGetErrorTypeId (<a href="#gad81d81a316ef38888533a24b786a6605">LLVMErrorRef</a> Err)</>}>
Returns the type id for the given error instance, which must be a failure value (i.e.

non-null).

### LLVMInstallFatalErrorHandler() {#gaf6159e6764fb23072ec25514b90b0ebd}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LLVMInstallFatalErrorHandler (<a href="#gaaba79ae56a17485c5d3fbd004ff60e47">LLVMFatalErrorHandler</a> Handler)</>}>
Install a fatal error handler.

By default, if LLVM detects a fatal error, it will call exit(1). This may not be appropriate in many contexts. For example, doing exit(1) will bypass many crash reporting/tracing system tools. This function allows you to install a callback that will be invoked prior to the call to exit(1).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/errorhandling-h/#l00036">36</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/errorhandling-h">ErrorHandling.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/errorhandling-cpp/#l00229">229</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/errorhandling-cpp">ErrorHandling.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMResetFatalErrorHandler() {#ga7ea3d621a4b178b39e068f2c017ae617}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void LLVMResetFatalErrorHandler (void)">
Reset the fatal error handler.

This resets LLVM&#39;s fatal error handling behavior to the default.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/errorhandling-h/#l00042">42</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/errorhandling-h">ErrorHandling.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/errorhandling-cpp/#l00234">234</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/errorhandling-cpp">ErrorHandling.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
